page.title: 06Farming in the Yarlet Area
page.content: its first spraying of fertiliser and perhaps reseeding will take place.By now,the animals will begin to graze in the fields again.The parlour is now thoroughly cleaned out. During the summer,two and possibly three cuts of silage will be made.Also further sprayings of weedkiller and fertiliser may be applied.By autumn,the animals are beginning to come in for longer periods as the nights get colder.A finalcut of hay or silage may be made.The straw arrives from Norfolk. Many of the fields in this area have old malr pits in them.Thhe origin of these is not fully understood:they may have been dug out to obtain clay for lining the canal or as samples for the pottery industry or to use on lighter land to help hold the water.
